level.text: A permanent guardianship subsidy may include:
Short-term payments, which are time-limited and intended to meet the cost of integrating a child into the family; and
Long-term payments, which are intended to help a permanent guardian whose income is limited and is likely to remain so.
The amount of the long-term permanent guardianship subsidy shall be:
Based on the applicant’s federal adjusted gross income, as defined by the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 or any successor legislation;
Based initially on the amount of the foster care board and care payment received by the applicant for the child’s care at the time that the application is approved; and
Following a review held pursuant to ยง 6105, based on the amount of the foster care board and care payment that would be paid for the child’s care if the child were in foster care.
The payment schedule for the long-term permanent guardianship subsidy shall be:
Based on the most recent determination of the median family income for the Washington, D.C. metropolitan statistical area as determined by the U.S. Census Bureau.
